alert.note: Alert for Benson; Cavalier; Eastern Walsh County; Eddy; Grand Forks; Griggs; Nelson; Pembina; Ramsey; Steele; Towner; Traill; Western Walsh County (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 17 at 3:56AM CST until February 18 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions are possible. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Minnesota and northeast and east central North Dakota. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to noon CST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Thursday night through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce the visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty south winds may combine with falling snow Thursday night to cause a brief period of near blizzard conditions. However, the strongest winds are expected on Friday, behind the cold front. Wind gusts up to 60 mph are possible, especially in open country along and west of the Red River Valley.
info.instruction: Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate winter clothing. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
